intro: Phelipanche pulchella, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems, which help it cling to supports as it climbs. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Phelipanche pulchella is native to Europe and parts of North Africa, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils.
